run_simulation module¶

Main script to assemble and run phase field simulations

run_simulation.get_output_dir_name(input_params)[source]¶

Set dynamical equations for the model

Args:
input_params (dict): Dictionary that contains input parameters
Returns:
output_dir (string): Name of the output directory including the important parameter names
run_simulation.run_simulation(input_params, concentration_vector, simulation_geometry, free_en, equations, out_directory)[source]¶

Integrate the dynamical equations for concentrations and write to files

Args:

input_params (dict): Dictionary that contains input parameters. We are interested in the parameters associated with the numerical method for integration

concentration_vector (numpy.ndarray): An nx1 vector of species concentrations that looks like \([c_1, c_2, ... c_n]\). The concentration variables \(c_i\) must be instances of the class fipy.CellVariable or equivalent.

simulation_geometry (Geometry): Instance of class utils.geometry.Geometry that describes the mesh geometry

free_en (utils.free_energy): An instance of one of the classes in mod:utils.free_energy

equations (utils.dynamical_equations): An instance of one of the classes in mod:utils.dynamical_equations out_directory (string): The directory to output simulation data

Returns:
err_flag (boolean): Whether the simulation has run successfully without any errors
